column1: Question
A small charge of 2 μC is placed in a uniform electric field of 500 N/C. Calculate the force experienced by the charge.
Using Gauss' Law, determine the electric flux through a spherical surface of radius 0.5 m, surrounding a point charge of 8 μC.
A particle with a charge of 1.5 μC is moved between two points in an electric field, where the potential difference is 12 V. Calculate the work done in moving the charge.
Calculate the capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor with plates of area 0.02 m² and separated by a distance of 1 mm, filled with a dielectric material of permittivity 5 ε₀.
Find the resistance of a copper wire that is 10 meters long and has a cross-sectional area of 0.5 mm². The resistivity of copper is 1.68 x 10⁻⁸ Ωm.
An AC circuit has a peak voltage of 170 V and a frequency of 60 Hz. Calculate the root mean square (RMS) voltage of this circuit.
A straight wire carrying a current of 5 A is placed in a uniform magnetic field of 0.2 T acting perpendicular to the wire. If the wire is 0.3 m long, calculate the force on the wire.
Using Faraday's Law, calculate the induced EMF in a coil of 200 turns when the magnetic flux through the coil changes at a rate of 0.04 Wb/s.
Determine the inductance of a solenoid with 500 turns, a length of 0.4 m, and a cross-sectional area of 0.01 m² when a current of 2 A flows through it.
A battery of 9 V is connected to a circuit with a total resistance of 18 Ω. Calculate the current flowing through the circuit.
A capacitor with a capacitance of 10 μF is charged to a potential of 5 V. Calculate the energy stored in the capacitor.
In a magnetic field of strength 0.5 T, a charged particle with a charge of 1.6 x 10⁻¹⁹ C moves at a velocity of 10⁶ m/s perpendicular to the field. Calculate the magnetic force on the particle.
A parallel plate capacitor with plates of area 1 m² and separation of 2 mm is connected to a 12 V battery. Calculate the electric field between the plates.
A ring of radius 0.3 m carries a uniformly distributed charge of 10 μC. Find the electric field at a point on the axis of the ring, 0.4 m from its center.
Calculate the potential energy of a system of two charges, 3 μC and -4 μC, placed 0.2 m apart.
A coil of wire with 50 turns has a magnetic flux of 0.01 Wb passing through it. If the flux is reduced to zero in 0.02 seconds, calculate the average induced EMF in the coil.
A wire of length 2 m moves perpendicularly through a magnetic field of 0.5 T at a speed of 3 m/s. Determine the EMF induced in the wire.
Find the capacitance of a cylindrical capacitor with inner radius 1 cm, outer radius 2 cm, and length 10 cm, filled with a dielectric material of relative permittivity 4.
In a RLC series circuit, a resistor of 15 Ω, an inductor of 0.1 H, and a capacitor of 20 μF are connected. Calculate the resonant frequency of this circuit.
A battery of 15 V is connected in series with a resistor of 10 Ω and a capacitor of 5 μF. Calculate the time constant of the circuit.
A solenoid with 300 turns per meter carries a current of 2 A. Find the magnetic field inside the solenoid.
An electron moving with a velocity of 2 x 10⁷ m/s enters a magnetic field of 0.3 T at an angle of 60°. Calculate the magnitude of the magnetic force on the electron.

A wire loop with an area of 0.05 m² and 10 turns is rotated in a magnetic field of 0.2 T. If the axis of rotation is perpendicular to the field and the loop rotates at 60 RPM, find the maximum EMF induced in the loop.
A lightning bolt transfers 5 C of charge from a cloud to the ground in 0.02 seconds. Calculate the average current during this strike.
A square loop of wire with side length 0.5 m is placed in a region with a magnetic field of 0.4 T. If the plane of the loop is parallel to the field, calculate the magnetic flux through the loop.
Calculate the electric potential at a point 0.1 m away from a charge of -8 μC in a vacuum.
A 100-turn coil with a radius of 10 cm is placed in a magnetic field of 0.03 T. The field is then turned off in 0.5 seconds. Determine the average induced EMF in the coil.
An electric kettle with a resistance of 30 Ω operates on a 240 V supply. Calculate the current flowing through the kettle.
A particle with a mass of 9.11 x 10⁻³¹ kg (electron) and charge -1.6 x 10⁻¹⁹ C moves in a circular path of radius 0.02 m in a magnetic field of 0.05 T. Find the speed of the particle.
Determine the capacitance of two parallel plates, each with an area of 0.03 m² and separated by a distance of 1.5 mm in air.
Calculate the resistance of a nichrome wire of length 20 m and diameter 0.1 mm. The resistivity of nichrome is 1.10 x 10⁻⁶ Ωm.
A proton (charge +1.6 x 10⁻¹⁹ C, mass 1.67 x 10⁻²⁷ kg) is accelerated from rest through a potential difference of 500 V. Find its final speed.
A circuit contains a 6 V battery, a 10 Ω resistor, and a coil with an inductance of 0.02 H. Calculate the time constant of this circuit.
A loop of wire with an area of 0.1 m² is placed in a uniform magnetic field of 1 T. If the loop is removed from the field in 0.1 second, what is the average induced EMF?
A superhero flies at a speed of 200 m/s perpendicular to the Earth's magnetic field of 50 μT. Calculate the voltage generated across the superhero's 2 m wingspan.
An electric train uses a DC motor that operates at 600 V. If the train's resistance is 0.5 Ω, find the current drawn by the motor.
Calculate the magnetic field at the center of a circular loop of wire with a radius of 30 cm carrying a current of 15 A.
A scientist shrinks to a height of 2 cm and carries a charge of 1 nC. She stands 1 m away from a large charged sphere. Calculate the electric force she experiences.

In a futuristic city, a magnetic levitation (maglev) skateboard is designed to float 5 cm above the ground using magnetic repulsion. If the skateboard's weight is 500 N and the magnetic field strength is 1 T, calculate the current required in the coils of the skateboard.
A deep-sea explorer uses a battery-powered submersible with a 12 V battery and a total resistance of 20 Ω. Calculate the power consumed by the submersible.
An alien spaceship emits a beam that creates an electric field of 10⁵ N/C on Earth's surface. Calculate the potential difference between two points 1 m apart within this field.

A scientist develops a tiny robot with a mass of 0.01 kg which moves in a straight line on a rail inside a 0.5 T magnetic field. If the robot carries a current of 2 A, determine the force acting on it.
Calculate the resonant frequency of a circuit consisting of a 1 μF capacitor and a 0.2 H inductor, designed by a student for a science competition.

A space station generates a circular magnetic shield with a radius of 100 m to protect against cosmic radiation. If the magnetic field strength required is 0.01 T, calculate the current needed in the loop generating this field.

A time traveler moves through a region with a time-varying magnetic field. If the field changes from 0 to 0.03 T in 0.02 seconds, and the traveler's metal suit has a loop area of 0.5 m², find the induced EMF in the suit.
A wizard conjures a lightning bolt that transfers 30 C of charge in 0.5 seconds. Calculate the average current of the lightning bolt.
In a futuristic lab, a scientist creates a magnetic field of 0.2 T around a circular area with a radius of 1.5 m. Calculate the magnetic flux through this area.
An adventurer finds an ancient artifact that generates an electric potential of 1000 V at a point 0.05 m away. Calculate the charge of the artifact.
A 50-turn coil with a radius of 5 cm is exposed to a magnetic field that increases from 0 to 0.1 T in 2 seconds. Determine the induced EMF in the coil.
A chef uses an electric grill with a resistance of 15 Ω connected to a 220 V supply. Calculate the current flowing through the grill.
A particle with a mass of 4.67 x 10⁻²⁶ kg (ion) and charge 3.2 x 10⁻¹⁹ C is trapped in a magnetic field of 0.08 T. If the radius of its circular path is 0.03 m, find its speed.
A pair of parallel plates, each with an area of 0.05 m² and separated by 2 mm in air, form a capacitor. Determine its capacitance.
Calculate the resistance of a copper wire of length 10 m and diameter 0.05 mm. The resistivity of copper is 1.68 x 10⁻⁸ Ωm.
A neutrally charged spacecraft acquires a charge of +2.0 x 10⁻¹⁰ C as it travels through space. If it encounters an electric field of 500 N/C, find the force acting on it.
A circuit consists of a 9 V battery, a 5 Ω resistor, and a coil with an inductance of 0.1 H. Calculate the time constant of this circuit.
A rectangular loop of wire with dimensions 0.2 m x 0.4 m is placed in a uniform magnetic field of 2 T. If the loop is rotated out of the field in 0.2 seconds, what is the average induced EMF?

A superhero with a wingspan of 3 m flies perpendicular to the Earth's magnetic field at a speed of 250 m/s. If the Earth's magnetic field strength is 30 μT, calculate the voltage generated across the superhero's wingspan.
A dragon with an electric breath weapon releases a 20,000 V electric discharge. If the dragon's breath has a resistance of 500 Ω, calculate the current produced.
In a distant galaxy, a space probe measures a magnetic field of 0.05 T on a planet's surface. If the probe carries a square loop of side 1 m, calculate the magnetic flux through the loop.
During a time travel experiment, a device creates a circular electric field with a radius of 2 m and an electric potential of 5000 V at its center. Find the electric field strength.

A scientist designs a time capsule with an electromagnetic lock that operates on an induced EMF of 5 V. If the magnetic field around the lock changes from 0.1 T to 0, over 1 second, what is the area of the coil used?
A robotic submarine uses a sonar system that generates an electric current of 2 A when connected to a 24 V battery. Calculate the resistance of the sonar system.

In a futuristic city, a magnetic levitation (maglev) train moves with a speed of 300 km/h over a track with a magnetic field strength of 0.04 T. If the train's undercarriage is 20 m long, calculate the induced EMF.
An alien spacecraft uses a high-capacity capacitor with a plate area of 0.1 m² and a plate separation of 1 mm. Calculate its capacitance in a vacuum.
A wizard enchants a metallic rod of length 1 m and diameter 2 mm with the conductivity of silver (1.59 x 10⁷ S/m). Find the resistance of the enchanted rod.
In a parallel universe, a particle with a mass of 9.11 x 10⁻³¹ kg and charge 1.6 x 10⁻¹⁹ C is subjected to an electric field of 3000 N/C. Calculate the acceleration of the particle.

A superhero with the ability to manipulate magnetic fields creates a uniform field of 0.5 T inside a solenoid with a length of 0.5 m and 200 turns. Calculate the magnetic field strength inside the solenoid.
A haunted house has a ghostly presence that generates a magnetic field of 3 T. If a metal loop with an area of 0.03 m² enters this field in 0.1 seconds, what is the induced EMF?
In a fantasy world, a sorcerer casts a spell that generates an electric field of 1000 N/C around an ancient relic. If the relic is charged to +3.0 x 10⁻⁸ C, calculate the force exerted on it.
In a science fiction city, a hoverboard is powered by a battery that provides a voltage of 36 V and a current of 2 A. Calculate the power consumption of the hoverboard.

On a distant ice planet, an explorer measures the resistance of a frozen wire to be 150 Ω at a temperature of -50°C. If the wire's resistance at 20°C is 100 Ω, calculate its temperature coefficient of resistance.
An underwater research facility uses a spherical capacitor with an inner radius of 0.5 m and an outer radius of 0.51 m. Calculate the capacitance of this spherical capacitor.
In a superhero's high-tech suit, a microchip operates at a potential difference of 5 V and has a capacitance of 10 μF. Calculate the energy stored in the microchip's capacitor.
During a lightning storm on an alien planet, a lightning bolt transfers a charge of 5 C over a potential difference of 100 MV. Calculate the energy released by the lightning bolt.

In a mystical forest, a tree generates an electrical potential of 200 V between its roots and its leaves. If a bird with a charge of 1 x 10⁻⁵ C perches on the tree, calculate the electrical potential energy of the bird.
A pirate's compass needle, with a magnetic moment of 0.5 A⋅m², aligns with the Earth's magnetic field of 4 x 10⁻⁵ T. Calculate the torque experienced by the compass needle.
In a futuristic energy plant, a coil with 500 turns and an area of 0.1 m² is rotated in a magnetic field of 0.2 T. If the coil rotates at 60 revolutions per minute, calculate the peak EMF generated.
A wizard's magical orb has a charge density of 1 x 10⁻⁶ C/m³ in a spherical volume with a radius of 2 m. Calculate the total charge inside the orb.
In a post-apocalyptic world, a survivor builds a radio receiver with an inductor of 250 μH and a capacitor of 1 μF. Calculate the resonant frequency of this LC circuit.

In a space station, an astronaut observes that a wire carrying a current of 3 A creates a magnetic field of 2 x 10⁻⁴ T at a distance of 0.1 m. Calculate the wire's length, knowing that it follows a straight path.

In an ancient temple, a treasure hunter finds a cylindrical capacitor with an inner radius of 1 cm, an outer radius of 2 cm, and a length of 5 cm. The dielectric material between the cylinders has a dielectric constant of 4. Calculate the capacitance of this capacitor.

A scientist in a hidden laboratory creates a magnetic field using a solenoid with 1000 turns, a length of 0.5 m, and a current of 2 A. Calculate the magnetic field inside the solenoid and the energy density of the field.

In a virtual reality game, a player uses a device that generates a uniform electric field of 1 x 10⁵ N/C. The device has a parallel-plate capacitor with a plate area of 0.02 m² and a separation of 1 mm. Calculate the capacitance and the charge on each plate.

On an extraterrestrial research mission, a probe measures the magnetic flux through a loop with an area of 0.1 m² and a magnetic field of 5 x 10⁻⁴ T. The probe rotates the loop by 90 degrees in 0.2 s. Calculate the induced EMF during this rotation.

In a steampunk city, an inventor creates a circuit with a battery of 12 V, a resistor of 8 Ω, and an inductor of 0.5 H. Calculate the time constant of the circuit and the current through the inductor after one time constant.

During a time travel experiment, a scientist charges a parallel-plate capacitor with a plate separation of 2 cm and a plate area of 0.05 m² to a potential difference of 5 kV. If the dielectric strength of air is 3 x 10⁶ V/m, determine whether a spark will occur.

In a fantasy world, a sorcerer conjures an electric field that varies sinusoidally in time with a maximum value of 3 x 10⁵ N/C and a frequency of 50 Hz. Calculate the displacement current density in a region with a vacuum permittivity.

A detective in a noir-style city uses a gauss meter to measure the magnetic field near a wire carrying an alternating current. The peak current is 10 A, and the frequency is 60 Hz. Calculate the peak magnetic field at a distance of 5 cm from the wire.

In a post-cybernetic world, a robot's arm contains a coil with a radius of 10 cm and 200 turns. If the coil is placed in a changing magnetic field that decreases from 0.5 T to 0 T in 0.1 s, calculate the induced EMF in the coil.

In a post-apocalyptic world, a survivor builds a simple AC generator using a rectangular loop of wire with dimensions 20 cm x 30 cm. The loop spins at a rate of 120 revolutions per minute in a magnetic field of 0.3 T. Calculate the peak EMF generated by this generator.

In a futuristic city, a magnetic levitation train uses superconducting magnets to create a magnetic field of 1.5 T. If the track has a length of 200 meters and a width of 10 meters, calculate the magnetic flux through one section of the track.

On a distant exoplanet, an alien scientist discovers a natural electric field of 5 x 10⁴ N/C. If the scientist uses a parallel-plate capacitor with a plate separation of 5 mm and a plate area of 0.01 m², calculate the charge accumulated on the plates.

In a hidden underwater laboratory, a researcher creates a solenoid valve that controls the flow of electrically conductive fluid. The solenoid has 500 turns, a length of 10 cm, and carries a current of 2 A. Calculate the magnetic field inside the solenoid.

During a high-stakes space mission, astronauts use a coil with 150 turns and a radius of 0.2 m to generate a magnetic field. If the current through the coil changes from 0 to 4 A in 0.1 s, calculate the induced EMF in the coil.

In a medieval fantasy world, a wizard creates a magical barrier using an electric field. The barrier is shaped like a spherical capacitor with an inner radius of 1 m and an outer radius of 2 m. Calculate the capacitance of this magical barrier.

During a science fair in a parallel universe, a student demonstrates wireless power transfer using a pair of coils, each with 100 turns and a radius of 15 cm. If the first coil is connected to an AC source of 120 V at 60 Hz, calculate the mutual inductance when the second coil is 10 cm away.

In an advanced alien civilization, scientists use a cylindrical capacitor to store energy. The capacitor has an inner radius of 2 cm, an outer radius of 5 cm, and a length of 30 cm. If the dielectric material has a dielectric constant of 6, calculate the capacitance.

On a deserted island, a castaway ingeniously creates a simple radio receiver with a single-turn loop antenna of radius 50 cm. If the antenna captures a radio wave with a magnetic field strength of 1 x 10⁻⁸ T at a frequency of 1 MHz, calculate the induced EMF.

In a mystical realm, a crystal emits a pulsating electric field that changes as E = E₀ sin(ωt), where E₀ is 2 x 10⁵ N/C and ω is 1000 rad/s. Calculate the displacement current density in a region of space with a vacuum permittivity.
